reviews.text: we arrived on a friday morning and were given a friendly welcome, the hotel is bright (even though the weather wasn't) and the staff friendly.Our room was clean and tidied every day.
The staff i found very helpful and they do try to get you anything you ask for in the dining room. Once they know your face they are always friendly you just need to be friendly with them.
reviews.title: some reservations

reviews.text: I stayed at Palas Pineda for week all inclusive in both June 2004 and 2005, and am looking forward to going back next year. I went with my sister and we liked the fact that the hotel catered to families, meaning that it was a peaceful place to stay while offering entertainment. We're both in our twenties but liked the fact that we weren't forced to join in with activities during the day or evening. Going all inclusive was a safe option too as didn't have to take money with us when we stayed round the pool so didn't have to worry when we left our seats to go for a swim.
reviews.title: A brilliant European hotel

likes.liked: — Good food, great pool, relaxing location
likes.disliked: — Getting up at 6am to get the best loungers

reviews.text: We also really appreciated the fact that it didn't cater exclusively for Brits, and we found the Germans and Spanish who stayed there to be really friendly. Staff are also helpful as long as you treat them with respect. We enjoyed the food on the whole although the large German clientele did mean that mystery meat in sauce was on the menu most nights but there was also always salad, pasta and sauce etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — Great choice and quality of food & Pool area
likes.disliked: — Poor attitude of some of the other guests ( cultural differences I suspect)

reviews.text: The surroundings of the hotel are gorgeous and it feels a bit palatial when you walk in. The rooms are always kept very clean and we never found the pool area untidy. The area of La Pineda is also gorgeous with some lovely shops and restaurants (the italian one on the sea front is particularly good) and Salou is very accessible by bus and offers even more shops and restaurants. The beach is fantastic too and makes a change to the hotel pool.
reviews.title: love it good value

likes.liked: — pool, food,near beach, not full of english people, relaxing, good for young families

reviews.text: Our favourtie features of the hotel is that it is truly relaxing not worrying about where to eat unless you want to eat outside the hotel. The entertainment was good, as long as you're into karaoke & flamenco! The hotel offers safes in each room which is a real bonus and the young guy who works in the kids club is gorgeous! I'm ashamed to say we watched several kids club shows so we could ogle him, but he is lovely!
reviews.title: Great if you make the effort a bit!

reviews.text: Only criticism is that sunbathing can be a competitive sport at the hotel and to get the really comfortable loungers you have to get there early! We were sad and got up 6am on a couple of occasions to get the fabric loungers but we weren't the only ones! Had some grumbles from a British family because we'd managed to get the good loungers several days running but they are truly more comfortable so it's worth.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic...but a few downfalls!!

reviews.text: Spent a 5 night stay with my wife and 8 year old daughter in August,2006 on an all inclusive arrangement, which we have regretted ever since.This hotel is far below the standards of a 4 star rating.Rooms are comfortable but need a makeover.
reviews.title: Problems galore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked the accommodation several months previous, we requested a quiet room but it turned out to be located at the rear of the hotel overlooking the service -area.We were awoken every night at about 3am by noisy refuse collecters, very disturbing for light sleepers.The hotel could not move us into another room as they were full.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.............

reviews.text: All inclusive guests are separated into another dining room.The food was only average and the hotel's Russian clientele are better catered for than the europeans.Salad items are served in water and not very appertising.My daughter lived on chips. Disappointingly, the dining room dress code was never enforced. During the day time the only snacks available was ice cream or crisps.
reviews.title: Not a 4 Star Hotel.
